description: Daily decisions exactly 2 std dev above mean (z-score = 2)
validation_query: WITH volume_stats AS (SELECT AVG(daily_decisions) AS mean_volume, STDDEV(daily_decisions) AS stddev_volume FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '90 days') SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, (daily_decisions - mean_volume) / stddev_volume AS zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends, volume_stats WHERE decision_day = '2024-12-15'
notes: Tests exact +2 std dev threshold - should trigger MAJOR (50). High volume anomaly detection

description: Daily decisions exactly 2 std dev below mean (z-score = -2)
validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, (daily_decisions - AVG(daily_decisions) OVER (ORDER BY decision_day ROWS BETWEEN 89 PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW)) / STDDEV(daily_decisions) OVER (ORDER BY decision_day ROWS BETWEEN 89 PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day = '2024-12-16'
notes: Tests exact -2 std dev threshold - should trigger MAJOR (50). Low volume anomaly detection

description: Crisis legislation surge: z-score = 3.5 (100 decisions in 1 day)
validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, (daily_decisions - mean) / stddev AS zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day = '2024-03-15' AND daily_decisions > 90
notes: Extreme surge (z=3.5) indicates crisis response or emergency legislation. Should trigger MAJOR

description: Parliamentary paralysis: z-score = -3 (0 decisions in 1 day)
validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day = '2024-11-20' AND daily_decisions = 0
notes: Extreme low volume (z=-3) indicates parliamentary gridlock or obstruction. Should trigger MAJOR

description: Normal decision volume within 1 std dev of mean
validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE zscore BETWEEN -1 AND 1 AND decision_day = '2024-12-10'
notes: Normal volume (z=0) should NOT trigger - validates normal behavior detection

validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, zscore, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM decision_day) AS month FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day = '2024-06-28' AND EXTRACT(MONTH FROM decision_day) IN (6, 12)
column17: December). Should be excluded from anomaly detection. Potential false positive

description: Gradually declining volume over 3 months (each day normal)
validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, moving_avg_30d, zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day BETWEEN '2024-09-01' AND '2024-12-01' ORDER BY decision_day
notes: Slow decline (50 → 38 avg) over 3 months may not trigger daily anomaly. False negative for gradual deterioration

validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, EXTRACT(DOW FROM decision_day) AS day_of_week, zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day = '2024-12-14' AND EXTRACT(DOW FROM decision_day) IN (0, 6)
notes: Weekend activity (Saturday/Sunday) is unexpected. Even moderate volume (25) on weekend warrants investigation - crisis indicator?

validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day IN (SELECT holiday_date FROM public_holidays) AND decision_day = '2024-12-24'
notes: Holiday activity (Christmas Eve) extremely unusual. Even low volume (15) on holiday indicates crisis. Should trigger MAJOR

description: Single day surge vs sustained high volume period
validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, zscore, moving_avg_7d FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day = '2024-10-15' AND daily_decisions > 90 AND moving_avg_7d < 50
notes: Single day surge (z=3.5) vs sustained high period (7-day avg high). Single spike more concerning than sustained high activity

validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, zscore, LAG(daily_decisions, 1) OVER (ORDER BY decision_day) AS prev_day FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day BETWEEN '2024-10-29' AND '2024-11-01' ORDER BY decision_day
notes: Accelerating volume (50 → 100) over 4 days signals crisis escalation. More concerning than single spike

validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day BETWEEN '2024-10-01' AND '2024-10-04' ORDER BY decision_day
notes: Crisis response completed - volume returning to normal. Should recovery pattern cancel previous anomaly alerts?

description: High volume during election campaign month (z=2.3)
validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE EXTRACT(MONTH FROM decision_day) = 9 AND EXTRACT(YEAR FROM decision_day) IN (SELECT election_year FROM elections)
notes: Election campaign month (September) may have higher activity. Should election periods be excluded from anomaly detection?

description: High volume in single committee (SkU: 50 decisions
notes: SELECT decision_day, committee, COUNT(*) AS committee_decisions, SUM(COUNT(*)) OVER (PARTITION BY decision_day) AS total_decisions FROM view_decision_temporal_trends GROUP BY decision_day, committee HAVING decision_day = '2024-11-10' AND committee = 'SkU'
column17: High volume concentrated in single committee (SkU) not system-wide surge. Committee-specific workload vs systemic anomaly?

description: Zero decisions due to system outage (data quality issue)
validation_query: SELECT decision_day, daily_decisions, zscore FROM view_decision_temporal_trends WHERE decision_day = '2024-10-25' AND daily_decisions = 0
notes: Zero decisions due to data collection failure (system outage). Should data quality issues be flagged separately from parliamentary paralysis?
